aed.description: On this map, one can find and mark nearby defibrillators
aed.title: Open AED Map

artwork.description: Welcome to Open Artwork Map, a map of statues, busts, grafittis and other artwork all over the world
artwork.title: Open Artwork Map

benches.description: This map shows all benches that are recorded in OpenStreetMap: Individual benches, and benches belonging to public transport stops or shelters. With an OpenStreetMap account, you can map new benches or edit details of existing benches.
benches.title: Benches

bicycle_rental.description: On this map, you'll find the many bicycle rental stations as they are known by OpenStreetMap
bicycle_rental.shortDescription: A map with bicycle rental stations and bicycle rental shops
bicycle_rental.title: Bicycle rental

bicyclelib.description: A bicycle library is a place where bicycles can be lent, often for a small yearly fee. A notable use case are bicycle libraries for kids, which allows them to change for a bigger bike when they've outgrown their current bike
bicyclelib.title: Bicycle libraries

binoculars.description: A map with binoculars fixed in place with a pole. It can typically be found on touristic locations, viewpoints, on top of panoramic towers or occasionally on a nature reserve.
binoculars.title: Binoculars

bookcases.description: A public bookcase is a small streetside cabinet, box, old phone booth or some other objects where books are stored. Everyone can place or take a book. This map aims to collect all these bookcases. You can discover new bookcases nearby and, with a free OpenStreetMap account, quickly add your favourite bookcases.
bookcases.title: Open Bookcase Map

campersite.description: This site collects all official camper stopover places and places where you can dump grey and black water. You can add details about the services provided and the cost. Add pictures and reviews. This is a website and a webapp. The data is stored in OpenStreetMap, so it will be free forever and can be re-used by any app.

0.description: Add a new official camper site. These are designated places to stay overnight with your camper. They might look like a real camping or just look like a parking. They might not be signposted at all, but just be defined in a municipal decision. A regular parking intended for campers where it is not expected to spend the night, is -not- a camper site
0.title: camper site

caravansites-capacity.question: How many campers can stay here? (skip if there is no obvious number of spaces or allowed vehicles)
caravansites-capacity.render: {capacity} campers can use this place at the same time

caravansites-charge.question: How much does this place charge?

caravansites-description.question: Would you like to add a general description of this place? (Do not repeat information previously asked or shown above. Please keep it objective - opinions go into the reviews)

0.then: You need to pay for use

1.then: Can be used for free

caravansites-fee.question: Does this place charge a fee?

1.then: There is internet access

caravansites-internet.question: Does this place provide internet access?

0.then: You need to pay extra for internet access

1.then: You do not need to pay extra for internet access

caravansites-internet-fee.question: Do you have to pay for the internet access?

0.then: Yes, there are some spots for long term rental, but you can also stay on a daily basis

1.then: No, there are no permanent guests here

2.then: It is only possible to stay here if you have a long term contract(this place will disappear from this map if you choose this)

1.then: This place does not have a sanitary dump station

caravansites-sanitary-dump.question: Does this place have a sanitary dump station?

1.then: This place does not have toilets

caravansites-website.question: Does this place have a website?

0.description: Add a new sanitary dump station. This is a place where camper drivers can dump waste water or chemical toilet waste. Often there's also drinking water and electricity.
0.title: sanitary dump station

1.then: You need to be a customer of camping/campersite to use this place

3.then: Anyone can use this dump station

dumpstations-access.question: Who can use this dump station?

dumpstations-charge.question: How much does this place charge?

0.then: You can dispose of chemical toilet waste here

1.then: You cannot dispose of chemical toilet waste here

dumpstations-chemical-waste.question: Can you dispose of chemical toilet waste here?

0.then: You need to pay for use

1.then: Can be used for free

dumpstations-fee.question: Does this place charge a fee?

0.then: You can dispose of grey water here

1.then: You cannot dispose of gray water here

dumpstations-grey-water.question: Can you dispose of grey water here?

dumpstations-network.question: What network is this place a part of? (skip if none)
dumpstations-network.render: This station is part of network {network}

0.then: This place has a water point

1.then: This place does not have a water point

dumpstations-waterpoint.question: Does this place have a water point?

0.then: This place has a power supply

1.then: This place does not have power supply

campersite.shortDescription: Find sites to spend the night with your camper
campersite.title: Campersites

charging_stations.description: On this open map, one can find and mark information about charging stations
charging_stations.shortDescription: A worldwide map of charging stations
charging_stations.title: Charging stations

climbing.description: On this map you will find various climbing opportunities such as climbing gyms, bouldering halls and rocks in nature.
climbing.descriptionTail:
The climbing map was originally made by Christian Neumann. Please get in touch if you have feedback or questions.

The project uses data of the OpenStreetMap project.

climbing_club-name.question: What is the name of this climbing club or NGO?

name.question: What is the name of this climbing gym?

1.then: This route is not bolted

Bolts.question: How many bolts does this route have before reaching the anchor?

Difficulty.question: What is the grade of this climbing route according to the french/belgian system?
Difficulty.render: The grade is {climbing:grade:french} according to the french/belgian system

Length.question: How long is this climbing route (in meters)?

0.then: This climbing route doesn't have a name

Name.question: What is the name of this climbing route?

Rock type.render: The rock type is {_embedding_features_with_rock:rock} as stated on the surrounding crag

Rock type (crag/rock/cliff only).question: What is the rock type here?

0.then: A climbing boulder - a single rock or cliff with one or a few climbing routes which can be climbed safely without rope

1.then: A climbing crag - a single rock or cliff with at least a few climbing routes

0.then: This climbing opportunity doesn't have a name

name.question: What is the name of this climbing opportunity?

1.then: Climbing area {name}
Climbing is possible here

The containing feature states that this is publicly accessible

The containing feature states that this is only accessible to customers
{_embedding_feature:access:description}

The containing feature states that this is only accessible to club members
{_embedding_feature:access:description}

1.then: You need a permit to access here

4.render: The routes are {canonical(climbing:length)} long on average

5.question: What is the grade of the easiest route here, according to the french classification system?
5.render: The lowest grade is {climbing:grade:french:min} according to the french/belgian system

6.question: What is the highest grade route here, according to the french classification system?
6.render: The highest grade is {climbing:grade:french:max} according to the french/belgian system

1.then: Bouldering is not possible here

2.then: Bouldering is possible, allthough there are only a few routes

Sport climbing is not possible here

climbing.title: Open Climbing Map

cycle_infra.description: A map where you can view and edit things related to the bicycle infrastructure. Made during #osoc21.
cycle_infra.shortDescription: A map where you can view and edit things related to the bicycle infrastructure.
cycle_infra.title: Bicycle infrastructure

cyclenodes.description: This map shows cycle node networks and allows you to add new nodes easily

node2node-survey:date.question: When was this node to node link last surveyed?
node2node-survey:date.render: This node to node link was last surveyed on {survey:date}

node-expected_rcn_route_relations.question: How many other cycle nodes does this node link to?
node-expected_rcn_route_relations.render: This node links to {expected_rcn_route_relations} other cycle nodes.

node-survey:date.question: When was this cycle node last surveyed?
node-survey:date.render: This cycle node was last surveyed on {survey:date}

cyclenodes.title: Cycle Node Networks

cyclestreets.description: A cyclestreet is is a street where motorized traffic is not allowed to overtake cyclists. They are signposted by a special traffic sign. Cyclestreets can be found in the Netherlands and Belgium, but also in Germany and France.

0.description: A cyclestreet is a street where motorized traffic is not allowed to overtake a cyclist
0.name: Cyclestreets

1.description: This street will become a cyclestreet soon
1.name: Future cyclestreet

2.description: Layer to mark any street as cyclestreet
2.name: All streets

0.then: This street is a cyclestreet (and has a speed limit of 30 km/h)

1.then: This street is a cyclestreet

2.then: This street will become a cyclstreet soon

3.then: This street is not a cyclestreet

1.question: When will this street become a cyclestreet?
1.render: This street will become a cyclestreet at {cyclestreet:start_date}

cyclestreets.title: Cyclestreets

cyclofix.description:
The goal of this map is to present cyclists with an easy-to-use solution to find the appropriate infrastructure for their needs.

You can track your precise location (mobile only) and select layers that are relevant for you in the bottom left corner. You can also use this tool to add or edit pins (points of interest) to the map and provide more data by answering the questions.

All changes you make will automatically be saved in the global database of OpenStreetMap and can be freely re-used by others.

For more information about the cyclofix project, go to cyclofix.osm.be.
cyclofix.title: Cyclofix - an open map for cyclists

drinking_water.description: On this map, publicly accessible drinking water spots are shown and can be easily added
drinking_water.title: Drinking Water

entrances.description: A map showing all entrances, which surveys for important aspects for wheelchair users
entrances.shortDescription: Survey entrances to help wheelchair routing
entrances.title: Entrances

etymology.description:
On this map, you can see what an object is named after. The streets, buildings, ... come from OpenStreetMap which got linked with Wikidata. In the popup, you'll see the Wikipedia article (if it exists) or a wikidata box of what the object is named after. If the object itself has a wikipedia page, that'll be shown too.

You can help contribute too!Zoom in enough and all streets will show up. You can click one and a Wikidata-search box will popup. With a few clicks, you can add an etymology link. Note that you need a free OpenStreetMap account to do this.

override.=name: Parks and forests without etymology information
Health and social places without etymology information

etymology.shortDescription: What is the origin of a toponym?
etymology.title: Open Etymology Map

facadegardens.description:
Facade gardens, green facades and trees in the city not only bring peace and quiet, but also a more beautiful city, greater biodiversity, a cooling effect and better air quality.
Klimaan VZW and Mechelen Klimaatneutraal want to map existing and new facade gardens as an example for people who want to build their own garden or for city walkers who love nature.
More info about the project at klimaan.be.

facadegardens-description.question: Extra describing info about the garden (if needed and not yet described above)

facadegardens-direction.question: What is the orientation of the garden?

1.then: There are no edible plants
There are flowering plants

facadegardens-plants.question: What kinds of plants grow here?

1.then: There is no rain barrel

facadegardens-rainbarrel.question: Is there a water barrel installed for the garden?

facadegardens-start_date.question: When was the garden constructed? (a year is sufficient)

0.then: The garden is in full sun

1.then: The garden is in partial shade

2.then: The garden is in the shade

facadegardens-sunshine.question: Is the garden shaded or sunny?

facadegardens.shortDescription: This map shows facade gardens with pictures and useful info about orientation, sunshine and plant types.
facadegardens.title: Facade gardens

fritures.description: On this map, you'll find your favourite fries shop!
fritures.title: Fries shops

ghostbikes.description:
A ghost bike is a memorial for a cyclist who died in a traffic accident, in the form of a white bicycle placed permanently near the accident location.

On this map, one can see all the ghost bikes which are known by OpenStreetMap. Is a ghost bike missing? Everyone can add or update information here - you only need to have a (free) OpenStreetMap account.
ghostbikes.title: Ghost bikes

grb.description: This theme is an attempt to help automating the GRB import.

building type.question: What kind of building is this?

0.then: Did not yet calculate the metatags... Reopen this popup

building type.question: What kind of building is this?

hackerspaces.description: On this map you can see hackerspaces, add a new hackerspace or update data directly

0.description: A hackerspace is an area where people interested in software gather
0.title: Hackerspace

1.description: A makerspace is a place where DIY-enthusiasts gather to experiment with electronics such as arduino, LEDstrips, ...
1.title: Makerspace

hackerspaces-name.question: What is the name of this hackerspace?

1.then: This hackerspace does not serve club mate

hs-club-mate.question: Does this hackerspace serve Club Mate?

1.then: This is a traditional (software oriented) hackerspace

is_makerspace.question: Is this a hackerspace or a makerspace?

hackerspaces.title: Hackerspaces

hailhydrant.description:
On this map you can find and update hydrants, fire stations, ambulance stations, and extinguishers in your favorite neighborhoods.

You can track your precise location (mobile only) and select layers that are relevant for you in the bottom left corner. You can also use this tool to add or edit pins (points of interest) to the map and provide additional details by answering available questions.

All changes you make will automatically be saved in the global database of OpenStreetMap and can be freely re-used by others.
hailhydrant.shortDescription: Map to show hydrants, extinguishers, fire stations, and ambulance stations.
hailhydrant.title: Hydrants, Extinguishers, Fire stations, and Ambulance stations.

mapcomplete-changes.description: This maps shows all the changes made with MapComplete

link_to_more.render: More statistics can be found here

mapcomplete-changes.title: Changes made with MapComplete

maps.description:
On this map you can find all maps OpenStreetMap knows - typically a big map on an information board showing the area, city or region, e.g. a tourist map on the back of a billboard, a map of a nature reserve, a map of cycling networks in the region, ...)

If a map is missing, you can easily map this map on OpenStreetMap.
maps.shortDescription: This theme shows all (touristic) maps that OpenStreetMap knows of
maps.title: A map of maps

nature.description: On this map, one can find interesting infromation for tourists and nature lovers, such as
nature.shortDescription: A map for nature lovers, with interesting POI's
nature.title: Into nature

notes.description:
A note is a pin on the map with some text to indicate something wrong.

Make sure to checkout the filter view to search for users and text.
notes.title: Notes on OpenStreetMap

observation_towers.description: Publicly accessible towers to enjoy the view
observation_towers.shortDescription: Publicly accessible towers to enjoy the view
observation_towers.title: Observation towers

openwindpowermap.description: A map for showing and editing wind turbines.

turbine-diameter.question: What is the rotor diameter of this wind turbine, in metres?
turbine-diameter.render: The rotor diameter of this wind turbine is {rotor:diameter} metres.

turbine-height.question: What is the total height of this wind turbine (including rotor radius), in metres?
turbine-height.render: The total height (including rotor radius) of this wind turbine is {height} metres.

turbine-operator.question: Who operates this wind turbine?
turbine-operator.render: This wind turbine is operated by {operator}.

turbine-output.question: What is the power output of this wind turbine? (e.g. 2.3 MW)
turbine-output.render: The power output of this wind turbine is {generator:output:electricity}.

turbine-start-date.question: When did this wind turbine go into operation?
turbine-start-date.render: This wind turbine went into operation on/in {start_date}.

openwindpowermap.title: OpenWindPowerMap

parkings.description: This map shows different parking spots
parkings.shortDescription: This map shows different parking spots

personal.description: Create a personal theme based on all the available layers of all themes. In order to show some data, open layer selection
personal.title: Personal theme

playgrounds.description: On this map, you find playgrounds and can add more information
playgrounds.title: Playgrounds

postboxes.description:
On this map you can find and add data of post offices and post boxes. You can use this map to find where you can mail your next postcard! :)
Spotted an error or is a post box missing? You can edit this map with a free OpenStreetMap account.

OH.question: What are the opening hours for this post office?

postboxes.shortDescription: A map showing postboxes and post offices
postboxes.title: Postbox and Post Office Map

shops.description: On this map, one can mark basic information about shops, add opening hours and phone numbers
shops.shortDescription: An editable map with basic shop information
shops.title: Open Shop Map

sport_pitches.description: A sport pitch is an area where sports are played
sport_pitches.title: Sport pitches

street_lighting.title: Street Lighting

surveillance.description: On this open map, you can find surveillance cameras.
